summary: The diff provides only truncated evidence of footer changes. While a summary line claims the footer is “without watermark branding,” the actual footer JSX containing (or removing) the “Built with ❤️ using caffeine.ai” text/link is not visible in the truncated AppLayout diff, so REQ-26 cannot be conclusively verified from the provided diff summary alone. Additionally, the diff includes unrelated project/documentation updates describing new authentication/password and workflow behaviors that were not requested.

missing_requirements.requirement: Remove the bottom-of-page watermark/branding from the application footer by deleting the “Built with ❤️ using caffeine.ai” text and the caffeine.ai outbound link so it no longer appears on any page.
missing_requirements.reason: The only relevant code file (AppLayout.tsx) is truncated at the start of the footer, so the diff summary does not show the removal of the “caffeine.ai” text nor confirm the outbound link is gone. A separate text summary claims the footer has no watermark branding, but that is not direct code evidence of removal across all routes.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (states “footer without watermark branding” but does not show code)

hallucinated_features.description: Updates describing password registration/verification flows and gating navigation based on password verification status.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly constrained changes to removing footer watermark/branding and to not introduce new authentication behavior; the diff includes documentation/state summaries claiming new password verification/auth gating behavior.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (describes password flow changes in App.tsx, useQueries.ts, LoginButton.tsx, ProfileSetupModal.tsx, AppLayout.tsx)
project_state.json (summary describes broader workflow features unrelated to REQ-26)

hallucinated_features.description: Updates describing landing/submit pages showing Google/Apple sign-in options.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested and outside the allowed scope (“Keep changes limited to removing the watermark/branding”).
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (LandingPage.tsx and SubmitComplaintPage.tsx summaries mention Google/Apple sign-in options)
